meanings.definition: Supernatural, mystical, or magical beliefs, practices, or phenomena.
meanings.sent1: The town was abuzz with rumors of the occult.
meanings.sent2: She delved into the world of the occult to find answers.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled nervously as they pretended to dabble in the occult.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a labyrinth of occult knowledge and ancient secrets.
meanings.sent5: The bookshop specialized in rare texts on the occult, attracting curious visitors.

meanings.definition: To conceal or hide from view.
meanings.sent1: She tried to occult her true feelings behind a smile.
meanings.sent2: The magician used sleight of hand to occult the coin from the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat attempted to occult itself among the bushes, thinking it was invisible.
meanings.sent4: The fog began to occult the city, shrouding it in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent5: He used a clever disguise to occult his identity from the spies.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the supernatural or mystical.
meanings.sent1: The old house had an occult aura that sent shivers down your spine.
meanings.sent2: She was drawn to the occult symbols etched on the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: The occult moon cast an eerie glow over the forest, creating a spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: His eyes held an occult wisdom that seemed to see beyond the physical world.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted an occult ritual, capturing the otherworldly essence perfectly.
